--- title: "Math Club" author: "Alex McSween" format: revealjs: incremental: true df-print: kable --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ## My Career - BSc in pure mathematics from uOttawa - MSc in mathematics and statistics from uOttawa - IT Officer at the Canadian Mathematical Society - Data Scientist at StatCan . . . ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){fig-align='center' width=1920} ::: ::: ## Undergrad {.smaller} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Other Undergrad Activities {.smaller} ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - CO-OP $\rightarrow$ Research Projects - Undergraduate conferences: - CUMC: Canadian undergraduate mathematics conference - DIM: Diversity in Math - SUMM: Les séminaires universitaires en mathématiques à Montréal - Volunteering: - women in math club - Let's Talk Science - Heart of the City Piano - Electives - Women + Gender studies - Arts courses ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.fragment .fade-in} ![women in math club](./static/wim.jpg) ::: ::: ::: ## MSc {.smaller} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-5-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Other MSc Activities {.smaller} ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - Covid? - Courses on communication for the sciences - How to break down problems - How to identify the important parts for an audience - Explaining technical topics without technical terms - More women in math club! - more engagement/support from professors - Association for Women in Math - PIMS Math^Industry internships ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.fragment .fade-in} ![first PR](./static/first_PR.png) ::: ::: ::: ## CMS {.smaller} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Other CMS Activities {.smaller} - Learned to use linux, python in a nonmathematical context - Learned to work with other people's code - Saw a bit of the less glamorous side of academia - Got to work on outreach projects with a real budget! ## StatCan {.smaller} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-7-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Other StatCan Activities {.smaller} ::: {.columns} ::: {.column} - A healthy Github presence/portfolio goes a long way - Networking after securing a job still matters! > Innovation Division $\rightarrow$ Data Science Division $\rightarrow$ Centre for Demography - Volunteering still matters! - RLadies ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.fragment .fade-in} ![RLadies](./static/RLadies.png) ::: ::: ::: ## In review... {.smaller} - Networking + strong support system - Creating a varied and interesting CV - Learning on the job is possible but hard - Finding something that motivates you ::: {.fragment .fade-in} ![Code challenge submission](./static/code-challenge.png){height=4in} ::: ## Population Projections - small area/population projections - mortality & life expectancy - National population projections: - cohort component projection - preparation of components ## Cohort component projection 1. Begin in year $t_0$ with a base population $P_0$ disaggregated into cohorts - cohorts can be age, gender, and/or region specific . . . ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display}
| Year|Region |Gender | X0| X1| X2| X3| X4| |----:|:-------|:------|--:|--:|--:|--:|--:| | 2025|Ontario |Men+ | 1| 2| 3| 9| 3| | 2025|Ontario |Women+ | 0| 8| 8| 8| 4| | 2025|Quebec |Men+ | 10| 1| 9| 3| 5| | 2025|Quebec |Women+ | 3| 10| 5| 4| 10|
::: ::: ## Cohort component projection 2. Determine what will happen to the population over the course of the year in a mathematical way: - compute (fertility, mortality, etc) rates for the interval $(t_0, t_0 + 1)$ per age, gender and region to represent the above . . . ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display}
| Year|Region |Gender | X0| X1| X2| X3| X4| |----:|:-------|:------|----:|----:|----:|----:|----:| | 2025|Ontario |Men+ | 0.72| 0.83| 0.22| 0.07| 0.71| | 2025|Ontario |Women+ | 0.75| 0.81| 0.35| 0.90| 0.34| | 2025|Quebec |Men+ | 0.46| 0.72| 0.27| 0.77| 0.54| | 2025|Quebec |Women+ | 0.65| 0.88| 0.55| 0.94| 0.32|
::: ::: ## Cohort component projection 3. Combine the above rates into a transition matrix $T^{a,g}$ for each age ($a$) and gender ($g$) cohort: - the diagonal is the net out-migration for a given region > ie. add the death rate, subtract the immigration rate, etc. - the off diagonal contains inter-regional migration rates only > ie. $T^{a,g}_{i,j}$ contains the rate of migration from region $i$ to region $j$. ## Cohort component projection 4. Compute the survival matrix . . . $$ S^{a,g} = \left(I - 0.5 * T^{a,g}\right)\left(I + 0.5 * T^{a,g}\right)^{-1}$$ 5. Multiply the base population by the survival matrices to obtain $P_1$. 6. Repeat to end of projection ## References - [Population Projections for Canada (2024 to 2074), Provinces and Territories (2024 to 2049): Technical Report on Methodology and Assumptions](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/91-620-x/91-620-x2025001-eng.htm) - [Population Projections for Canada, Provinces and Territories: Interactive Dashboard](https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/71-607-x/71-607-x2022015-eng.htm)

  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
